p: Many fungi have been extensively studied and proved to be good biosorbents of heavy metals, such as Rhizopus arrhizus [ 11- 14], Aspergillus spp. [ 6, 15- 17], Penicillium spp. [ 17, 18] and Saccharomyces spp. [ 2, 19]. However, white-rot fungi were relatively less reported for their biosorption though they were strong degrader of various xenobiotics and detoxicating materials of contaminated effluents [ 20, 21]. They also possess the capacity of heavy metal biosorption [ 21].
